Marketing Manager at Forest City Realty Trust
January 6, 2015, Mariam reported directly to Gustavo

‘Ridiculously passionate’ is the phrase that comes to mind when I think of Gustavo. I had the pleasure of being a student in his Global Marketing Strategy class at Loyola Marymount University. Gustavo’s ability to evoke creativity and to push me to think strategically was incredibly beneficial both inside and outside of the classroom. Out of the four years I’ve been in college, I have never learned, grasped and used so much information in the ‘real word’ as I have today, thanks to Gustavo’s teachings. I also have never had a professor who truly allows for #limitless and #bold thinking, going far beyond what I thought I was capable of. I wish the class lasted longer or that I could have had more years to learn from him. As cliché as it may sound, Gustavo has been the best coach I have EVER had! And wish every single student could have an opportunity of taking a course with him and feel as empowered as I did.

July 25, 2014, Pooja reported directly to Gustavo

Gustavo has restored my faith in CSULA's ability to hire quality professors that challenge, motivate and inspire.  In my 3 years at this university I had yet to encounter a professor that truly moved me.  His "analytical/application" method of teaching gave me so much more than a fleeting memory of marketing terms, but instead, he imparted  me with a method of thinking, one centered around constant questioning and innovation that enables me to look at any problem in a highly analytical way.  I've taken away so much from being Gustavo's student, it was a great experience.

July 11, 2014, Nicholas reported directly to Gustavo

Professor Demoner was in a word, innovative. His teaching style was unmatched in my years at CSULA, as he brought a very unique style of learning to the classroom. We learned directly from text as is accustomed in any classroom, but he also made sure that through his extensive real life experience we knew how to apply these theories in real life. He made us question what we thought we knew of marketing/marketing research and figure out unique approaches for simple problems. In the classroom he had us do group thinks often so we became comfortable in situations where we were able to place ideas of many into one, sort of grand collaboration. I learned that sometimes my own ideas are not the best, and to trust the people that are surrounding me to make the right call when my own judgement is clouded. I enjoyed being in the presence of Prof. Demoner, as he brought a positive attitude with him every time he taught, and I am truly grateful to have had the opportunity to learn from this man.

Mariam graduated at the top 1% of my super demanding creative marketing course at Loyola Marymount University. She is a great young leader, with an innovative mind that is sure to disrupt all industries crossing her path. Her teamwork skills strike a nice balance between motivating others to do more, and making everyone accountable for their responsibilities. The mastery level Mariam achieved in de-constructing business models, just to rearrange the parts again in unique ways, allowed her to develop ideas bold enough to turn heads from Silicon Beach to Silicon Valley.
